name: Chromosome 17q21.31 Microduplication Syndrome
chief_complaint: My child has severe developmental delays and unusual facial features
prognosis: Variable depending on duplication size and affected genes; most patients require lifelong support with moderate-severe developmental impairment
description: A rare genomic disorder caused by a microduplication of the 17q21.31 region, containing multiple genes including KANSL1. The phenotype overlaps with but is distinct from the reciprocal deletion causing Koolen-de Vries syndrome. The condition affects multiple systems with prominent neurological involvement.
risk_factors: inherited from parent with balanced translocation
